narrative.narrative: Kuban Airlines was around from its split as a division of Aeroflot in 1992 until December 11,2012. It was based at Krasnodar in a region which is historically called Kuban. It also had a base at Moscow Vnukovo. Near the end some of its routes were from KRR to Moscow Vnukovo,St. Petersburg,Sochi,Anapa and international ones to Istanbul,Turkey Yerevan,Armenia and Tel Aviv,Israel, on a scheduled basis. Seasonal routes included Larnaca,Cyprus Antalya,Turkey and Sharm el Sheikh,Egypt. Other scheduled domestic routes were Moscow Vnukovo to Chelyabinsk,Kaliningrad and Nalchik and from St. Petersburg it served Nizhnevartovsk. At the end its fleet had five 737-300's,two 737-500's and three A319-100's. It had got three of the 737-300's in 2010. In September 2011 low cost carrier Sky Express merged into Kuban giving them two more 737-300's ,the 737-500's and A319's. Previously it operated Russian and Soviet made planes, like the Yak-42D,Tupolev Tu-154M and Antonov 24. It had ordered 12 Sukoi Superjets but these were not delievered before its demise.
